name: CloudFrontDistributionConfigCustomErrorResponse
description: CustomErrorResponse is a property of the CloudFront DistributionConfig resource that defines custom error messages for certain HTTP status codes.

properties.name: ErrorCachingMinTTL
properties.description: The minimum amount of time, in seconds, that Amazon CloudFront caches the HTTP status code that you specified in the ErrorCode property. The default value is 300.

properties.name: ErrorCode
properties.description: An HTTP status code for which you want to specify a custom error page. You can specify 400, 403, 404, 405, 414, 500, 501, 502, 503, or 504.

properties.name: ResponseCode
properties.description: The HTTP status code that CloudFront returns to viewer along with the custom error page. You can specify 200, 400, 403, 404, 405, 414, 500, 501, 502, 503, or 504.

properties.name: ResponsePagePath
properties.description: The path to the custom error page that CloudFront returns to a viewer when your origin returns the HTTP status code that you specified in the ErrorCode property. For example, you can specify /404-errors/403-forbidden.html.
